DataElement.preferredName: Person Platinum Compound Chemotherapy Sensitivity Therapy Option Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions that allow a person to participate in a clinical study that address platinum-sensitive chemotherapy as an alternative choice or action as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Platinum Compound Chemotherapy Hypersensitivity Therapeutic Procedure Options Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._A chemotherapy compound that contains a platinum atom. Platinum compounds do not contain alkyl groups but do cause DNA crosslinks and adducts similar to alkylating agents. DNA crosslinks and adducts ultimately lead to the induction of apoptosis._The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases._An immune response that occurs following exposure to an innocuous antigen, but that does not require the presence of preformed antibodies to the antigen._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Alternative choices or actions._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Platinum Compound Chemotherapy Hypersensitivity Therapeutic Procedure Options Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A chemotherapy compound that contains a platinum atom. Platinum compounds do not contain alkyl groups but do cause DNA crosslinks and adducts similar to alkylating agents. DNA crosslinks and adducts ultimately lead to the induction of apoptosis.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.:An immune response that occurs following exposure to an innocuous antigen, but that does not require the presence of preformed antibodies to the antigen.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Alternative choices or actions.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A chemotherapy compound that contains a platinum atom. Platinum compounds do not contain alkyl groups but do cause DNA crosslinks and adducts similar to alkylating agents. DNA crosslinks and adducts ultimately lead to the induction of apoptosis.
The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
An immune response that occurs following exposure to an innocuous antigen, but that does not require the presence of preformed antibodies to the antigen.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has platinum-sensi
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has platinum-sensitive ovarian cancer (dose expansion phase only), does their provider feels that PLD would be an appropriate treatment option?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has ovarian cancer, does patient have platinum-sensitive disease and has received at least one platinum-based therapy?
